summary: Dr. Robert J. Reilly was charged with failing to meet the standard of care and failing to keep adequate medical records, particularly regarding the inappropriate prescribing of opioid and benzodiazepine medications for chronic pain patients. He initially received a reprimand, one year of probation, and was ordered to cease treating chronic pain patients and complete specific medical education courses. Subsequently, Dr. Reilly voluntarily surrendered his medical license, effective April 19, 2018, stating he no longer wished to comply with the Consent Order's terms and was retiring.
